titleStmt.title: Cata-baptism: or new baptism, waxing old, and ready to vanish away. In two parts. The former containes LVIII. considerations, (with their respective proofs, and consectaries) pregnant for the healing of the common scruples touching the subject of baptism, and manner of baptizing. The latter, contains an answer to a discours against infant-baptism, published not long since by W.A. under the title of, Some baptismall abuses brielfy discovered, &c. In both, sundry things, not formerly insisted on, are discovered and discussed. / By J.G. a minister of the Gospel of Jesus Christ.
titleStmt.author: Goodwin, John, 1594?-1665.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by H Cripps, and L. Lloyd, and are to be sold at their shops neer the castle in Cornhil, and in Popes-head-Alley.,

notesStmt.note: In part a reply to: Allen, William. An answer to Mr. J.G. his XL queries.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: their shops neer the castle in Cornhil
